channel.title: Cannot connect
channel.description: For some reason i cannot connect to my own server. Before you say "you need to connect to local host", it was working fine before untill it crashes and i log out, now i get the message "error connecting to server". i scanned my ports with various port checkers and now the ports i opened are now closed. Don't try and be smart and say "ports aren't opened they are forwarded" or something i'm not in the mood for smart arses

item.title: Cannot connect
item.dc:creator: @bibbobbib bibbobbib
item.description:
@bibbobbib wrote:

if i changed the ip then others wouldn’t be able to connect, which they can
and i just checked canyouseeme.org and it said “success i can see your service on port 43594”
i tried my old delta server and that worked just my pi that doesn’t work

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot connect
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“bibbobbib, post:5, topic:432800”][quote author=whackatre link=topic=535508.msg3915265#msg3915265 date=1329098087]

It was fine for months before that and I haven’t touched any of the files.
I was thinking maybe a DoS attack or something.
Idk

Lolno.

To check if this is a server/client problem, try a different source.
[/quote]

Tried different source and it worked.
now what?
change source or something?[/quote]

Perhaps. Make sure you’re positive you didn’t make just a small careless mistake in renaming the IP.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot connect

item.description:
@bibbobbib wrote:

For some reason i cannot connect to my own server. Before you say “you need to connect to local host”, it was working fine before untill it crashes and i log out, now i get the message “error connecting to server”.
i scanned my ports with various port checkers and now the ports i opened are now closed.
Don’t try and be smart and say “ports aren’t opened they are forwarded” or something
i’m not in the mood for smart arses
